Package com.alibaba.ttl.threadpool.agent

Class TtlAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.alibaba.ttl.threadpool.agent.TtlAgent
  • public final class TtlAgent
extends Object
    TTL Java Agent.

    The configuration for TTL agent

    Configure TTL agent via -D property(System.getProperties()) or TTL agent arguments.

    1. -D property config format is: -Dkey1=v2 -Dkey2=v2
    2. TTL agent arguments config format is key1:v1,key2:v2.
      separate key-value pairs by char ,, and separate key-value by char :.
    NOTE about the config sources and the precedence:
    1. Read -D property(System.getProperties()) first.
    2. if no -D property configured(including empty property value configured by -Dkey1/-Dkey1=), read TTL Agent argument configuration.
    Below is available TTL agent configuration keys.

    Configuration key: Log Type

    The log type of TTL Java Agent is configured by key ttl.agent.logger. Since version 2.6.0.

    • ttl.agent.logger : STDERR
      only log to stderr when error. This is default, when no/unrecognized configuration for key ttl.agent.logger.
    • ttl.agent.logger : STDOUT
      Log to stdout, more info than ttl.agent.logger:STDERR; This is needed when developing.

    Configuration example:

    1. -Dttl.agent.logger=STDOUT
    2. -javaagent:/path/to/transmittable-thread-local-2.x.y.jar=ttl.agent.logger:STDOUT

    Configuration key: Disable inheritable for thread pool

    Enable "disable inheritable" for thread pool, configured by key ttl.agent.disable.inheritable.for.thread.pool. When no configuration for this key, default is false(aka. do NOT disable inheritable). Since version 2.10.1.

    • rewrite the ThreadFactory constructor parameter of ThreadPoolExecutor to DisableInheritableThreadFactory by util method getDisableInheritableThreadFactory.
    • rewrite the ForkJoinPool.ForkJoinWorkerThreadFactory constructor parameter of ForkJoinPool to DisableInheritableForkJoinWorkerThreadFactory by util method getDisableInheritableForkJoinWorkerThreadFactory.
    More info about "disable inheritable" see TransmittableThreadLocal.

    Configuration example:

    1. -Dttl.agent.disable.inheritable.for.thread.pool=true
    2. -javaagent:/path/to/transmittable-thread-local-2.x.y.jar=ttl.agent.disable.inheritable.for.thread.pool:true

    Configuration key: Enable TimerTask class decoration

    Enable TimerTask class decoration is configured by key ttl.agent.enable.timer.task. Since version 2.7.0.

    When no configuration for this key, default is true(aka. enabled).
    Note: Since version 2.11.2 the default value is true(enable TimerTask class decoration); Before version 2.11.1 default value is false.

    Configuration example:

    1. -Dttl.agent.enable.timer.task=false
    2. -javaagent:/path/to/transmittable-thread-local-2.x.y.jar=ttl.agent.enable.timer.task:false

    Configuration key: logging the transform class received by TTL Agent

    Enable logging the transform class received by TTL Agent by key ttl.agent.log.class.transform, default is false(aka. do NOT logging the transform class received by TTL Agent). Since version 2.13.0.

    Configuration example:

    1. -Dttl.agent.log.class.transform=true
    2. -javaagent:/path/to/transmittable-thread-local-2.x.y.jar=ttl.agent.log.class.transform:true

    Multi key configuration example

    For -D property config, simply specify multiply -D property, example:
    -Dttl.agent.logger=STDOUT -Dttl.agent.disable.inheritable.for.thread.pool=true

    For TTL agent arguments config, example:
    -javaagent:/path/to/transmittable-thread-local-2.x.y.jar=ttl.agent.logger:STDOUT,ttl.agent.disable.inheritable.for.thread.pool:true

    About boot classpath for TTL agent

    NOTE: Since v2.6.0, TTL agent jar will auto add self to boot classpath.
    But you should NOT modify the downloaded TTL jar file name in the maven repo(eg: transmittable-thread-local-2.x.y.jar).
    if you modified the downloaded TTL agent jar file name(eg: ttl-foo-name-changed.jar), you must add TTL agent jar to boot classpath manually by java option -Xbootclasspath/a:path/to/ttl-foo-name-changed.jar.

    The implementation of auto adding self agent jar to boot classpath use the Boot-Class-Path property of manifest file(META-INF/MANIFEST.MF) in the TTL Java Agent Jar:

    Boot-Class-Path
    A list of paths to be searched by the bootstrap class loader. Paths represent directories or libraries (commonly referred to as JAR or zip libraries on many platforms). These paths are searched by the bootstrap class loader after the platform specific mechanisms of locating a class have failed. Paths are searched in the order listed.

    More info about Boot-Class-Path see The mechanism for instrumentation.

    Since:
    0.9.0
    Author:
    Jerry Lee (oldratlee at gmail dot com)
    See Also:
    Instrumentation, The mechanism for instrumentation, JAR File Specification - JAR Manifest, Working with Manifest Files - The Javaâ„¢ Tutorials, TransmittableThreadLocal, ThreadPoolExecutor, ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor, ForkJoinPool, TimerTask
